language.description: The language used in your application

database_url.description: The URL of the application database

hostname.description: The hostname or IP address of the application database. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

port.description: The port number of the application database. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

username.description: The username to use when connecting to the application database. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

password.description: The password to use when connecting to the application database. Developers are strongly encouraged to use environment variable substitution to avoid storing secrets in source. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

connectionTimeoutMillis.description: The number of milliseconds the system waits before timing out when connecting to the application database. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

app_db_name.description: The name of the application database. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

sys_db_name.description: The name of the system database

ssl.description: Use SSL/TLS to securely connect to the database (default: true). DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

ssl_ca.description: If using SSL/TLS to securely connect to a database, path to an SSL root certificate file. DEPRECATED: Use database_url instead

app_db_client.description: Specify the database client to use to connect to the application database

migrate.description: Specify a list of user DB migration commands to run

rollback.description: Specify a list of user DB rollback commands to run. DEPRECATED: use your migration tool directly

addContextMetadata.description: Adds contextual information, such as workflow UUID, to each log entry

logLevel.description: A filter on what logs should be printed to the standard output

silent.description: Silences the logger such that nothing is printed to the standard output

logsEndpoint.description: The URL of an OTLP collector to which to export logs

tracesEndpoint.description: The URL of an OTLP collector to which to export traces

port.description: The port number of the application server (Default: 3000)

admin_port.description: The port number of the admin server (Default: 3001 or the app server port + 1)

setup.description: Commands to setup the application execution environment
